image.altText: Red fire retardant being dropped from a plane.

props.synopsis: Two fires which threatened lives and homes on the outskirts of Perth are now contained.

title.children: Firefighters contain two major bushfires in Perth after relentless 48 hours of emergencies

image.altText: Medics prepare premature babies for transport to Egypt after they were evacuated from hosptal in Gaza City.

props.synopsis: The UN is investigating whether the "rules of war" have been broken by Israel and Hamas. But what qualifies as a war crime?

title.children: The humanitarian crisis in Gaza reveals the limitations of international law

image.altText: a young woman in a white top speaks into a microphone

props.synopsis: In the mid 2000s, Tina Chou was a bubbly pop star on her way to the top. Almost two decades on, she has joined the growing chorus of women speaking up as the MeToo movement sweeps across Taiwan.

title.children: Tina Chou accused a powerful man of sexual harassment. Then he sued her

image.altText: Anthony Albanese looks annoyed as he addresses the media

props.synopsis: The PM is finishing the year with a sullen electorate that can't really see past the economic pain it is feeling, and national security back in the realm of talk about border security and terrorists, writes Laura Tingle.

title.children: A sullen electorate, an opponent with lethal populism and unanswered questions: Can Albanese regain control in 2024?

image.altText: A Christmas tree is seen on a windy and rainy Bondi Beach in Sydney

props.synopsis: Violent thunderstorms are likely across eastern Australia this Christmas, rivalling some of the most intense and widespread storm outbreaks of the past few decades.

title.children: Severe storms to light up eastern Australia's Christmas

image.altText: A chinese aircraft

props.synopsis: The news sparked controversy in the island, with think tank Taiwan Economic Democracy Union warning authorities to investigate suspicions of election bribery and political interference.

title.children: Battle in the sky: China's efforts to get Taiwanese back to the island to vote

image.altText: Side profile headshot of a mother hugging her daughter, looking glum

props.synopsis: Authorities in Western Australia remain on high alert after five bushfire emergencies in two days destroyed homes and caused major disruption.

title.children: 'There aren't any words': Family in shock as bushfire destroys home days out from Christmas

image.altText: Pigs running towards fire torn piggery.

props.synopsis: A court has heard a state-owned electricity company knew about issues that led to a large bushfire for a decade before the blaze. It also heard it would have taken two days to fix them.

title.children: Western Power fined $80,000 for causing devastating Wheatbelt bushfire

image.altText: Linda Thomas-Greenfield sits at a desk, flanked by others, with a folder of documents, microphone and a 'United States' sign

props.synopsis: After days of delays, the UN Security Council adopts a watered-down resolution urging faster aid supplies for Gaza — but a call for an "urgent suspension of hostilities" is dropped to avoid another American veto.

title.children: UN Security Council passes Gaza aid resolution, avoiding veto as US and Russia abstain

image.altText: A young couple is handed a set of silver house keys.

props.synopsis: It's now common knowledge that loans and gifts from family are a large part of breaking into the housing market. But how is parental financial support being used in other areas?

title.children: The 'bank of mum and dad' might be crucial for buying a house, but new research shows it goes well beyond that

image.altText: Photo merge of movies Wish, Migration, Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom and Wonka.

props.synopsis: Exhausted and ready for a rest? Here are some movies to take the kids to.

title.children: Kid-friendly movies to go see this summer — that you just might enjoy

image.altText: A composite of a reconstruction of St Nicholas's face next to a photo of an elderly man dressed as Santa Claus.

props.synopsis: St Nicholas's generosity and gift-giving inspired the Christmas legend of Santa Claus. But instead of climbing down chimneys to deliver presents, the real-life bishop from ancient Greece would secretly leave bags of gold on windowsills and doorsteps.

title.children: Who was the real Santa Claus? We sort the facts from the fiction

image.altText: Security officers escort Pakistan's former Prime Minister Imran Khan.

props.synopsis: Pakistan's Supreme Court grants former prime minister Imran Khan bail in a case related to a leak of state secrets, but it is not clear how he can be released while serving a three-year sentence for corruption and facing other charges.

title.children: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan granted bail, but release remains uncertain

image.altText: Obstacle equipment attached to the ceiling with rock climbing walls in the background.

props.synopsis: The business is the latest to shut up shop due to what has been dubbed the "amusement insurance crisis", with caravan parks, community events and pubs also finding it increasingly difficult to secure public liability insurance.

title.children: Insurance 'crisis' hits indoor adventure businesses, forcing popular WA ninja gym to close its doors

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann and Brittany Higgins at The Dock

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann's barrister tells the Federal Court it cannot rely at all on the evidence of Brittany Higgins, as he makes his closing arguments in the defamation case brought by the former Liberal staffer.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's lawyer questions Brittany Higgins's credibility in closing arguments of defamation case

image.altText: Jai Opetaia points to the Ring belt

props.synopsis: Three former heavyweight world champions, an undefeated light heavyweight world champion and Australia's cruiserweight king Jai Opetaia all head to the Arabian desert for the biggest card in boxing history.

title.children: Boxing's biggest ever card in its most controversial location

image.altText: An Australian bowler appeals for a wicket in the women's Test against India in Mumbai.

props.synopsis: After a flurry of wickets before tea, Australia went wicketless in the final session on day two of the one-off women's Test match with India finishing 7-376.

title.children: India's women on top after day two of Test against Australia

image.altText: Sricharan Karthikeyan

props.synopsis: A group of students in Melbourne's south-east create an app that tells you when the food you buy is set to expire, and reminds you to use it up. Their efforts are attracting both local and global attention.

title.children: This 15yo recognised food waste was a problem, so he and his friends designed an app to help fix it

image.altText: Three newborn puppies in a woman's hands.

props.synopsis: Dogs swim out of an animal shelter to safety as floodwaters in the Cairns region rise, and pregnant Minnie births seven pups in a foster home while waiting for the shelter to reopen.

title.children: Azura fostered one dog for the Cairns floods and now has seven puppies

image.altText: A man wearing glasses sits at a desk with letters in front of him. There is a Christmas tree in the background.

props.synopsis: Father Christmas is writing back to dozens of children in a Queensland country town and surrounds thanks to a local paramedic, parents and the post office.

title.children: Handwritten letters from ambo Santa keep Christmas spirit alive in Queensland country town

image.altText: A blurred out woman sits in front of a Christmas tree

props.synopsis: Two women say poor rental records after fleeing violent homes, skyrocketing rental prices and a general "stigma" are preventing them from starting a new life in regional New South Wales.

title.children: After fleeing domestic violence, all Kelly wants for Christmas is a home for her family

image.altText: Jessi Hooper, wearing all black, sits in her wheelchair in front of a home with Christmas decorations.

props.synopsis: What sparks joy for some, can pose a health risk for others. But experts say there is a way for people with photosensitivity to enjoy Christmas lights.

title.children: When Christmas lights start going up, Jessi goes inside

image.altText: A toddler decorating a Christmas tree

props.synopsis: Emma and Dallas had feared that they and their nine children would be spending Christmas Day in the bush, but this week they received the best news they could have hoped for — a house they can call home for the next 18 months.

title.children: As a family with nine children celebrates their first Christmas in a new home, others are still in tents in the bush

image.altText: Image of a teenager wearing a white hoodie. He is looking out of frame.

props.synopsis: British teenager Alex Batty, who was found in France after going missing six years ago, has revealed he returned to the UK for a better future.

title.children: British teenager Alex Batty, who was found after going missing six years ago, says he left France for a better future

image.altText: A woman with her hair in a bun and a blue shirt standing outside with her husband.

props.synopsis: A traumatised mother of two has spoken out after a terrifying attack as acts of kindness remind her that Townsville is a caring and wonderful city.

title.children: 'It was beautiful, so unexpected': Melissa gifted a new car after falling victim to harrowing youth crime attack

image.altText: Illustration of woman and man sitting on a car bonnet

props.synopsis: The 18-year-old went on a solo cybercrime spree  in 2022 where he targeted Uber, Revolut and threatened to release code from an upcoming Grand Theft Auto sequel.

title.children: Hacker who blackmailed Grand Theft Auto developers sentenced to indefinite hospital detention

image.altText: A Bonza aircraft on a runway.

props.synopsis: Outback Queensland residents are in uproar as another round of flight cancellations means families will be separated for Christmas, or forced to pay thousands of dollars for last-minute flights.

title.children: 'Absolutely disgraceful': Sudden Bonza flight cancellations leave outback residents stranded for Christmas

image.altText: A baby swimming towards a dollar bill.

props.synopsis: Spencer Elden's lawsuit alleges that he has suffered "permanent harm" as the band and others profited from the image of him which featured on an album cover.

title.children: Court revives lawsuit against Nirvana over 1991 Nevermind naked baby album cover
